I have been a PayMaya user since 2017 and in my Virtual Card, it clearly indicates that the expiration is April 2021. February 11, 2020, I received this notification through SMS saying, ‚Äú Thank you for registering and using your PayMaya Virtual Card for online transactions. Improve your experience now by upgrading your account for Free! On the app, go to Menu, click ''Upgrade For Free,'' and have at least P100 in your account. With an upgraded account you can have a higher balance limit, send money, and withdraw from any Bancnet/VISA/Mastercard ATM here and abroad. Your current virtual card will last until (Feb 17, 2020). Kindly disregard if you are already in the process of upgrading your account.‚Äù - FreeInfoMsg 1.) Not understanding the benefit of upgrading, I did not upgrade. 2.) Since in my Virtual Card, it clearly states that the expiration is April 2021 and was not notified to disregard the said date I ignored the February 17, 2020 date. 3.) February 17, 2020, I was planning to load my Virtual Card until I received this notification saying, ‚ÄúThank you for registering and using your PayMaya Virtual Card for your online transactions. We've noticed that you have not used your card in the last 30 days. Hence, we have deactivated your card for security reasons. We encourage you to avail of a new Virtual Card by upgrading your account for Free. Just go to Menu> click ''Upgrade For Free.'' Just make sure you have at least P100 in your account to view and start using your Virtual Card. Kindly disregard this message in case you've already settled all pending charges.‚Äù - FreeInfoMsg 1.) I have not used my Virtual Card in the last 30 days. - Really? I just paid 2 services using PayMaya last week. 2. Hence, we have deactivated your card for security reasons. - Deactivated my Account for security reasons. There was no email or push notification stating the probable cause and no link to re activate my account. When I called the Customer Service, I was told that I should disregard the February 17 message since it is system generated. Okay, it was system generated, but why did they deactivate my account and again, there was no link to reactivate it. The Customer Service agent said that I need to upgrade my Virtual Card. When asked when did they deactivate my account, I was told that it was yesterday, February 16. Paymaya deactivated my account without notification and did it ahead of the date that they required me to upgrade my Virtual Card. 3.) Kindly disregard this message in case you've already settled all pending charges. - Settled all pending charges? What pending charges? As far as I know I have money in my PayMaya Account that I cannot use because you deactivated my account. Why would I need to place P100 just to view my new Virtual Card? I was planning to load my account this morning without knowing that I have a deactivated account. At the moment I cannot see my Virtual Card in the App unless I place P100 in my account. As I see, it seems that PayMaya is forcing its users to Upgrade. The push notification is not working. When I checked the App, it‚Äôs stated there that they blocked my card 6 hours ago, but the Customer Service said it was done yesterday. Also, while it is stated in the App that my card is blocked, still, I was able to buy a load for my phone. Such inconsistency. How can this be secured? Uninstalling.
I cannot buy load from the shop.. your customer support takes a month before they reply. 0 star for your service better switch to gcash

Pros:
This App has a much more stable credit card gateway and payment gateway. All web payment transactions using virtual work seamlessly almost everywhere. You can even link PayMaya to your Apple ID. Coolest integration so far. 

But why 1 star? For this app. 

First, I‚Äôd say The app developers need to really focus on a CICD app strategy...completely lacking fresh periodic updates. 

It appears as if a Proper Functional test cases for each service seem missing from this app strategy. An easy one For example, after transferring money from your bank account into PayMaya, it still relies on Javascript redirect before you are brought back to the main menu. That‚Äôs so early 2000‚Äôs programming.. Otherwise 9/10 times you find yourself confusingly backtracking to the main menu by clicking ‚Äúback‚Äù button. 

Common PayMaya, spend as much as you guys do on marketing into making the mobile app experience better.. if you can think up great commercials you can at least surpass GrabApp in features and functionality being that you guys have been in the market for quite a while...
